item.title: The tikzDevice for R Users
item.description: What is the tikzDevice The tikzDevice is a R package that transforms R plots into $\LaTeX$ codes blocks. Those $\LaTeX$ codes can be complied by pdfLaTeX (or other $\TeX$ engines) with the help of TikZ — a graphics package for TeX and friends written by Till Tantau. On the website $\TeX$ample you may find many beautiful pictures created using TikZ/PGF (TikZ is a set of higher-level macros built on top of PGF).

item.title: How to Create Multiple Pages in Blog Style with Jekyll
item.description: Multiple Blogs on One Site1 Suppose that you have two categories of blogs. item.title: Make Links Open in New Windows/Tab for Markdown
item.description: Using jQuery to Open External Links in New Windows1 Creating (static) webpages using markdown is every convenient, for example [Queensborough Community College](http://www.qcc.cuny.edu). However, left clicking a link by default opens it in the same window. If there are only a few links, one may use html codes to open a link in a new window, for example <a href="http://www.qcc.cuny.edu" target="_blank">Queensborough Community College</a>. When there are many links it will be a little bit painful to create such links using html in a markdown file.

item.title: Tips for RStudio Setup for RMarkdown and More
item.description: Don’t install R to the default location. Instead, choose a location such as C:\Program Files\R. Verdict: no version difference issue Create a .Renviron file to your home directory ~/ using the following function: # File will be created if it doesn't exist file.edit('~/.Renviron') Add R_LIBS_USER="C:/R" to .Renviron. This variable will be the library of R packages. It is extremely useful if you are using a computer with limited rights and anti-virus softwares.
